atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities`, and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: The @apply directive is used to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: The @layer directive is used to tell Tailwind which “bucket” a set of custom styles belong to.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: The @config directive is a new feature that lets you specify which config file Tailwind should use when compiling that CSS file.
